sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Extruder-Spheronizer for production of spherical pellets by extrusion and spheronization of pharmaceutical wet mass for controlled release formulations.
sections.scope: Applicable to pelletization activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Ensure both extruder and spheronizer are installed on stable foundations.
Verify that all electrical and utility connections are secure.
Check that extrusion screens and spheronizer plate are clean and properly installed.
Select appropriate screen size based on desired pellet diameter.
Install the selected screen in the extruder die assembly.
Prepare wet mass by mixing powder with appropriate binder solution.
Ensure wet mass has optimal moisture content and consistency for extrusion.
Power ON the extruder and set rotation speed as per product requirements.
Feed wet mass into the extruder hopper at a controlled rate.
Monitor extrudate formation and ensure uniform cylindrical ropes.
Adjust feed rate or moisture content if extrusion is irregular.
Collect extrudates directly or transfer to spheronizer immediately.
Power ON the spheronizer and set rotation speed (typically 500-2000 rpm).
Load extrudates into the spheronizer bowl.
Allow spheronization process to continue for specified duration (typically 2-10 minutes).
Monitor pellet rounding and adjust speed or time if needed.
Stop the spheronizer once spherical pellets are formed.
Discharge pellets from spheronizer into collection trays.
Spread pellets in thin layers for drying.
Dry pellets using appropriate drying equipment (fluid bed dryer or tray dryer).
Screen dried pellets to obtain desired size fraction.
Clean extruder screen, spheronizer plate, and all equipment parts thoroughly.
Document all processing parameters and pellet characteristics in the batch record.
precautions: Maintain optimal wet mass consistency for successful extrusion.
Use appropriate screen size to achieve target pellet size.
Avoid over-wetting or under-wetting which affects pellet quality.
Monitor spheronization time carefully to prevent over-processing.
Clean extruder screen promptly to prevent clogging.
Ensure proper friction plate condition in spheronizer.
Do not overload spheronizer bowl beyond recommended capacity.
Dry pellets properly to prevent agglomeration during storage.
Wear appropriate PPE including gloves, mask, and protective clothing.
Follow lockout/tagout procedures during cleaning and maintenance.
